Vulnerabilities: SQL Injection in the login page
SecurityMeasures: Input validation on the login page

Steps.Description: Exploit the SQL Injection vulnerability to retrieve the password from the database.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that the password can be retrieved through SQL Injection.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker uses sqlmap to send SQL Injection payloads and analyze the response to extract the password from the database.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully retrieves the password from the database.

Steps.Description: Bypass the login page using the retrieved password.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that bypassing the login page with the retrieved password will grant access to the system.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker modifies the password field in the login request with the retrieved password and sends the request using Burp Suite.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully bypasses the login page and gains access to the system.
